title: Response to market forces in China and Mexico

content.prompt: Which of the following is the best explanation of how two AP Comparative Government and Politics course countries have responded to global market forces?

choices.label: Mexico has withdrawn from the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) to protect domestic industry, while China has privatized its economy to promote competition.
The United Kingdom has nationalized the banking industry to regulate credit markets, while Iran has allowed the Revolutionary Guard to supervise the economy to protect national interests.
China has created special economic zones (SEZs) to increase foreign direct investment, while Mexico has privatized some of its oil industry to increase competition.
The United Kingdom has nationalized natural resources to increase state revenue, while Russia has privatized natural resources to increase competition.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

topic.text: 5.2: Political Responses to Global Market Forces

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
